column2: INDIANA DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign indicates:
column8: A shared lane

column2: 2. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 3. Using a smartphone while driving is permitted as long as the driver is using a hands-free device.
4. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 5. A flashing yellow light:
column4: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 6. The sign in the picture:
column4: means that you need to stop.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column10: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column8: You may make a U-turn.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: Yield ahead

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column8: Slippery when wet

column2: 10. If you are arrested with a blood-alcohol concentration (BAC) of .08 percent or more, your driving privileges will be suspended for at least six months.
11. Slow vehicles should travel in the the left-hand lane except when passing or making a left turn.
12. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column8: red, yellow and green

column2: 13. When an emergency vehicle approaches using a siren, air horn or a red or blue flashing light, drivers must move to the right side of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
14. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column6: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column8: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column10: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.

column2: 15. Speed limit signs are:
column8: regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 16. Your driving privileges may be revoked for giving false information to the Secretary of State.
17. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column8: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal is not operational
column8: No traffic signal ahead

column2: 19. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column8: Call the police.

column2: 20. Most rear-end collisions are caused by vehicle operators following another vehicle more closely than is reasonable and prudent.
21. If the front right wheel of a vehicle runs off the pavement, the driver should slow down by easing off the accelerator, then gently steer back onto the pavement.
22. This road sign means:
column8: Pedestrian Crossing

column2: 23. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 24. What message will be found on this pennant shaped sign?
column8: Drive with caution: the road ahead turns right.

column2: 25. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there's an intersection ahead.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 26. On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns close to the center line.
27. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column10: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 28. If your car goes into water, you should:
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 29. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column6: This street is reserved for trucks
column8: Hill

column2: 31. Motorcyclists are entitled to use the full width of a traffic lane; therefore, a driver should pass a motorcycle the same way as passing another vehicle.
32. Trying to beat a tractor-trailer to a single-lane construction zone creates a particularly dangerous situation.
33. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 34. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 35. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column10: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 36. Alcohol is the single greatest factor in fatal motor vehicle accidents.
37. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 38. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column8: Marijuana.

column2: 39. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 40. Drivers should treat a railroad crossbuck sign the same as a yield sign.
41. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 42. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 43. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column6: As far to the right as possible.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 44. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column8: increase your speed immediately.
column10: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 45. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you must do it.
column10: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 46. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 47. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column8: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 48. A motorist who refuses to submit to a chemical test will face a suspension of driving privileges for up to two years.
49. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column8: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 50. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: The same as a green light.
